content.question: (a) Write the second-degree Taylor polynomial for f about <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>x</mi> <mo>=</mo> <mn>0</mn> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiVu0Je9sqqrpepC0xbbL8F4rqqrFfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9 vqaqpepm0xbba9pwe9Q8fs0=yqaqpepae9pg0FirpepeKkFr0xfr=x fr=xb9adbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaamaabaabaaGcbaGaamiEaiabg2 da9iaaicdaaaa@38B3@ </annotation> </semantics> </math> and use it to approximate <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>f</mi> <mo stretchy="false">(</mo> <mn>0.2</mn> <mo stretchy="false">)</mo> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiVu0Je9sqqrpepC0xbbL8F4rqqrFfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9 vqaqpepm0xbba9pwe9Q8fs0=yqaqpepae9pg0FirpepeKkFr0xfr=x fr=xb9adbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaamaabaabaaGcbaGaamOzaiaacI cacaaIWaGaaiOlaiaaikdacaGGPaaaaa@3A62@ </annotation> </semantics> </math>.

frqParts.text: (a) Write the second-degree Taylor polynomial for f about <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>x</mi> <mo>=</mo> <mn>0</mn> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiVu0Je9sqqrpepC0xbbL8F4rqqrFfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9 vqaqpepm0xbba9pwe9Q8fs0=yqaqpepae9pg0FirpepeKkFr0xfr=x fr=xb9adbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaamaabaabaaGcbaGaamiEaiabg2 da9iaaicdaaaa@38B3@ </annotation> </semantics> </math> and use it to approximate <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>f</mi> <mo stretchy="false">(</mo> <mn>0.2</mn> <mo stretchy="false">)</mo> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiVu0Je9sqqrpepC0xbbL8F4rqqrFfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9 vqaqpepm0xbba9pwe9Q8fs0=yqaqpepae9pg0FirpepeKkFr0xfr=x fr=xb9adbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaamaabaabaaGcbaGaamOzaiaacI cacaaIWaGaaiOlaiaaikdacaGGPaaaaa@3A62@ </annotation> </semantics> </math>.

(b) Let g be a function such that <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>g</mi> <mo stretchy="false">(</mo> <mi>x</mi> <mo stretchy="false">)</mo> <mo>=</mo> <mi>f</mi> <mo stretchy="false">(</mo> <msup> <mi>x</mi> <mn>3</mn> </msup> <mo stretchy="false">)</mo> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiVu0Je9sqqrpepC0xbbL8F4rqqrFfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9 vqaqpepm0xbba9pwe9Q8fs0=yqaqpepae9pg0FirpepeKkFr0xfr=x fr=xb9adbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaamaabaabaaGcbaGaam4zaiaacI cacaWG4bGaaiykaiabg2da9iaadAgacaGGOaGaamiEamaaCaaaleqa baGaaG4maaaakiaacMcaaaa@3E73@ </annotation> </semantics> </math>. Write the fifth-degree Taylor polynomial for <math> <semantics> <msup> <mi>g</mi> <mo>′</mo> </msup> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiVu0Je9sqqrpepC0xbbL8F4rqqrFfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9 vqaqpepm0xbba9pwe9Q8fs0=yqaqpepae9pg0FirpepeKkFr0xfr=x fr=xb9adbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaamaabaabaaGcbaGabm4zayaafa aaaa@36EE@ </annotation> </semantics> </math>, the derivative of g, about <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>x</mi> <mo>=</mo> <mn>0</mn> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiVu0Je9sqqrpepC0xbbL8F4rqqrFfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9 vqaqpepm0xbba9pwe9Q8fs0=yqaqpepae9pg0FirpepeKkFr0xfr=x fr=xb9adbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaamaabaabaaGcbaGaamiEaiabg2 da9iaaicdaaaa@38B3@ </annotation> </semantics> </math>.

(c) Write the third-degree Taylor polynomial for f about <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>x</mi> <mo>=</mo> <mn>1</mn> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiVu0Je9sqqrpepC0xbbL8F4rqqrFfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9 vqaqpepm0xbba9pwe9Q8fs0=yqaqpepae9pg0FirpepeKkFr0xfr=x fr=xb9adbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaamaabaabaaGcbaGaamiEaiabg2 da9iaaigdaaaa@38B4@ </annotation> </semantics> </math>.

(d) It is known that <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mo>|</mo> <msup> <mi>f</mi> <mrow> <mo stretchy="false">(</mo> <mn>4</mn> <mo stretchy="false">)</mo> </mrow> </msup> <mo stretchy="false">(</mo> <mi>x</mi> <mo stretchy="false">)</mo> <mo>|</mo> <mo>≤</mo> <mn>300</mn> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiVu0Je9sqqrpepC0xbbL8F4rqqrFfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9 vqaqpepm0xbba9pwe9Q8fs0=yqaqpepae9pg0FirpepeKkFr0xfr=x fr=xb9adbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaamaabaabaaGcbaGaaiiFaiaadA gadaahaaWcbeqaaiaacIcacaaI0aGaaiykaaaakiaacIcacaWG4bGa aiykaiaacYhacqGHKjYOcaaIZaGaaGimaiaaicdaaaa@416B@ </annotation> </semantics> </math> for <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mn>0</mn> <mo>≤</mo> <mi>x</mi> <mo>≤</mo> <mn>1.125</mn> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiVu0Je9sqqrpepC0xbbL8F4rqqrFfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9 vqaqpepm0xbba9pwe9Q8fs0=yqaqpepae9pg0FirpepeKkFr0xfr=x fr=xb9adbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaamaabaabaaGcbaGaaGimaiabgs MiJkaadIhacqGHKjYOcaaIXaGaaiOlaiaaigdacaaIYaGaaGynaaaa @3EBA@ </annotation> </semantics> </math>. The third-degree Taylor polynomial for f about <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>x</mi> <mo>=</mo> <mn>1</mn> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiVu0Je9sqqrpepC0xbbL8F4rqqrFfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9 vqaqpepm0xbba9pwe9Q8fs0=yqaqpepae9pg0FirpepeKkFr0xfr=x fr=xb9adbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaamaabaabaaGcbaGaamiEaiabg2 da9iaaigdaaaa@38B4@ </annotation> </semantics> </math>, found in part (c), is used to approximate <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>f</mi> <mo stretchy="false">(</mo> <mn>1.1</mn> <mo stretchy="false">)</mo> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiVu0Je9sqqrpepC0xbbL8F4rqqrFfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9 vqaqpepm0xbba9pwe9Q8fs0=yqaqpepae9pg0FirpepeKkFr0xfr=x fr=xb9adbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaamaabaabaaGcbaGaamOzaiaacI cacaaIXaGaaiOlaiaaigdacaGGPaaaaa@3A62@ </annotation> </semantics> </math>. Use the Lagrange error bound along with the information about <math> <semantics> <mrow> <msup> <mi>f</mi> <mrow> <mo stretchy="false">(</mo> <mn>4</mn> <mo stretchy="false">)</mo> </mrow> </msup> <mo stretchy="false">(</mo> <mi>x</mi> <mo stretchy="false">)</mo> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiVu0Je9sqqrpepC0xbbL8F4rqqrFfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9 vqaqpepm0xbba9pwe9Q8fs0=yqaqpepae9pg0FirpepeKkFr0xfr=x fr=xb9adbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaamaabaabaaGcbaGaamOzamaaCa aaleqabaGaaiikaiaaisdacaGGPaaaaOGaaiikaiaadIhacaGGPaaa aa@3B85@ </annotation> </semantics> </math> to find an upper bound on the error of the approximation.

topic.text: 10.11: (BC ONLY) Finding Taylor Polynomial Approximations of Functions

skill.text: Skill 1.F: Explain how an approximated value relates to the actual value.
